definitions_spanish: nombre de la letra a en el alfabeto shipibo
definitions_english: name of the letter a in the Shipibo alphabet
grammatical_notes: Used as the name of the letter a in the Shipibo alphabet

definitions_spanish: agregado al final del verbo para señalar el pasado, el pasivo o la acción terminada
usado con verbo compuesto del participio pasado e iqui para indicar el tiempo pasado especialmente en una narración
al final del verbo subordinado en la oración adverbial
al final del verbo subordinado en la oración de conjunción subordinada
agregado a la raíz del verbo con el sentido de 'hacer'
definitions_english: added to the end of the verb to indicate the past tense, passive voice, or completed action
used with compound verb of past participle and iqui to indicate past tense especially in narration
at the end of the subordinated verb in an adverbial clause
at the end of the subordinated verb in a subordinate conjunction clause
added to the verb root with the sense of 'to make, to cause'

examples.spanish: La mujer que está sentada es mi tía materna.
examples.english: The woman who is sitting is my maternal aunt.

examples.spanish: El que está sentado me está mirando.
examples.english: The one who is sitting is looking at me.

examples.shipibo: Moátianronqui Yóashico Incaqui rétecana iqui. Réteshonqui huestiora jóni jahuen shenín síquita iqui.
examples.spanish: Cuentan que antiguamente mataron al Inca Mezquino y que un hombre se pintó con su grasa.
examples.english: They say that long ago they killed the Inca Mezquino and that a man painted himself with his fat.

examples.spanish: Si papá me manda, yo traigo la gallina.
examples.english: If dad sends me, I will bring the chicken.

examples.shipibo: Nocon huái óroa pecaora, ea náshiai.
examples.spanish: Después de cultivar mi chacra, voy a bañarme.
examples.english: After cultivating my field, I am going to bathe.
ashenti to make learn, to teach

grammatical_notes: Used to indicate past tense, passive voice, completed action; used with past participle compounds; used in subordinate adverbial and conjunction clauses; used as causative suffix meaning 'to make/cause'; used as postposition meaning 'of, from'

examples.shipibo: Rimámea ópo ábionin jóquetianra noa rároque.
examples.spanish: Cuando el Presidente vino de Lima en avión, nos alegramos.
examples.english: When the President came from Lima by plane, we were happy.

examples.shipibo: Cáshiboainoa ábionbora moa masáti queybque. Ishónbira nato simánainra moa bénshóaribacánai.
examples.spanish: Todas las avionetas de Cashibococha se han descompuesto, pero esta semana las van a reparar.
examples.english: All the small planes of Cashibococha have broken down, but this week they are going to repair them.

grammatical_notes: Used with location adverbs to indicate origin of subject; frequently used with -ash in compound form -ash to indicate a place of origin

examples.shipibo: Moátianronqui Incánqui jahuen sontárobo ashánti ráanshon áboanique.
examples.spanish: Cuentan que antiguamente, el Inca mandó a sus soldados a que pescaran y los convirtió en manshacos.
examples.english: They say that long ago, the Inca sent his soldiers to fish and he turned them into manshaco fish.

examples.shipibo: Papán piára sarámpinin icash áco banéque.
examples.spanish: Mi primo, el sobrino de papá, tuvo sarampión y se adelgazó.
examples.english: My cousin, my dad's nephew, had measles and became thin.

examples.spanish: El gallinazo come las carachamás muertas y resecas.
examples.english: The vulture eats the dead and dried out carachamá fish.

examples.shipibo: Cáchio caquínra ochixón mananábihue méraquen moa inón piá; ja biásha pápa rároque jíria íti shinánash.
examples.spanish: Al ir al monte, el perro encontró un motelo vacío que un tigre había comido; y al cogerlo, papá se alegró, al pensar que todavía estaba vivo.
examples.english: Upon going to the forest, the dog found an empty motelo (tortoise) shell that a tiger had eaten; and upon picking it up, dad was happy, thinking it was still alive.
